channel.title: Comments on: How much do web developers earn? What is their salary?

item.title: By: Barry Carter
item.dc:creator: Barry Carter
item.description: Front-End Developers focus their efforts on the website’s interface and user interaction. The core of their work is done with JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, associated frameworks like Angular and Backbone, and libraries like jQuery. Salaries range from about $43,000 to $102,000, according to PayScale, with a median of $66,000. A front-end developer with strong skills in Angular can earn more — an average of $78,000.
item.content:encoded: Front-End Developers focus their efforts on the website’s interface and user interaction. The core of their work is done with JavaScript, CSS3, HTML5, associated frameworks like Angular and Backbone, and libraries like jQuery. Salaries range from about $43,000 to $102,000, according to PayScale, with a median of $66,000. A front-end developer with strong skills in Angular can earn more — an average of $78,000.

item.title: By: John Peter
item.dc:creator: John Peter
item.description: Back-End Developers concentrate on what goes on behind the scenes of a website. These are the people who build the databases that host the site’s content and implement the technologies that runs its search and e-commerce capabilities. Focused more on the website’s responsiveness and speed than what its pages look like, they’re skilled in languages such as Python and PHP, and frameworks like Django and Ruby on Rails. Their pay ranges from $43,000 to $116,000, PayScale says, with a median of $75,000.
item.content:encoded: Back-End Developers concentrate on what goes on behind the scenes of a website. These are the people who build the databases that host the site’s content and implement the technologies that runs its search and e-commerce capabilities. Focused more on the website’s responsiveness and speed than what its pages look like, they’re skilled in languages such as Python and PHP, and frameworks like Django and Ruby on Rails. Their pay ranges from $43,000 to $116,000, PayScale says, with a median of $75,000.

item.title: By: Ahmed Hassan
item.dc:creator: Ahmed Hassan
item.description:
If you’re in a rush and need career direction, skip straight to the lessons at the end.
THE NUMBERS
I’m a front-end developer, previously full-stack, in the UK. Here are the dates, compensation and years’ experience:
2005: £15K ($18.6K), 0 years 2008: £17.5K ($21.7K), 3 years 2010: £28K ($34.8K), 5 years 2014: £42K ($52.1K), 9 years 2016: £400/day ($497/day), 11 years
item.content:encoded:
If you’re in a rush and need career direction, skip straight to the lessons at the end.

THE NUMBERS

I’m a front-end developer, previously full-stack, in the UK. Here are the dates, compensation and years’ experience:

2005: £15K ($18.6K), 0 years
2008: £17.5K ($21.7K), 3 years
2010: £28K ($34.8K), 5 years
2014: £42K ($52.1K), 9 years
2016: £400/day ($497/day), 11 years

item.title: By: Aaron Aiken
item.dc:creator: Aaron Aiken
item.description:
Among the most common job titles you’ll see:
Web Developer: A person whose primary responsibilities include the programming and development work involved in creating a working website. Though this is largely a technical role, a certain amount of business knowledge and communications skill is important to doing the job successfully. the average Web developer’s salary ranges from $36,000 to $80,000, depending where they live and how much experience they have. The median is about $54,000, but recruiters say demand for job candidates is pushing pay higher. Senior Web developers’ pay ranges from $52,000 to $107,000, says PayScale, and experience with technologies like C# and Java can result in even more money.
item.content:encoded:
Among the most common job titles you’ll see:

Web Developer: A person whose primary responsibilities include the programming and development work involved in creating a working website. Though this is largely a technical role, a certain amount of business knowledge and communications skill is important to doing the job successfully. the average Web developer’s salary ranges from $36,000 to $80,000, depending where they live and how much experience they have. The median is about $54,000, but recruiters say demand for job candidates is pushing pay higher. Senior Web developers’ pay ranges from $52,000 to $107,000, says PayScale, and experience with technologies like C# and Java can result in even more money.
